intro: Alypum monspeliensium, commonly known as the Mediterranean fumitory, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and northern Africa. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in loose clusters. Alypum monspeliensium is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
